thread.title: Navarro, Brown lead Bound Brook football over Pingry
thread.title_full: Navarro, Brown lead Bound Brook football over Pingry

title: Navarro, Brown lead Bound Brook football over Pingry
text:
Navarro, Brown lead Bound Brook football over Pingry Colin Maxwell, Correspondent 4:27 p.m. EDT October 10, 2015 Football 1 CONNECT 5 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
BASKING RIDGE Two Mid-State 38 Valley Division opponents faced off on a crisp fall afternoon on Saturday as both attempted to stay in the playoff hunt. 
After multiple defensive stops by both teams to set the tone early in the first quarter, Bound Brook senior captain and wide receiver Darius Brown changed that tune as he caught a 38-yard touchdown pass from junior quarterback Alex Navarro and the Crusaders defeated The Pingry School 20-0 on Saturday. 
Brown and Navarro have been getting things going as of late, as both have had a connection on the football field for as long as they can remember. 
“I have known Alex my whole life, as we grew up playing Pop Warner together, and now that he is back on the team this year we have been regaining our connection again on the football field,” Brown said. 
Alex Navarro transferred to Cherokee High School last season before transferring back to Bound Brook this year, as he has lead his team to a winning record at 3-2. 
Navarro found Brown five times for 121 yards and a touchdown on the day, as Navarro finished with six completions on 11 passing attempts with 134 yards and the touchdown. 
The Big Blue (1-4) recovered a Bound Brook fumble as the Crusaders were driving early in the second quarter, but the offensive line for Pingry could not get much going on the afternoon as the Bound Brook defense was relentless. 
Junior running back Joe Warren extended Bound Brook’s lead by 14 points at the end of the first half with a nifty 7-yard touchdown run. 
The Crusaders offensive line opened up running lanes for Warren and senior running back Drake Roach for most of the afternoon. 
“The O-line plays so hard, they never give up, and they know how to get their assignments done every time,” Brown said. 
Roach carried the ball 17 times and gathered 80 rushing yards and sophomore running back Joshua Ejiogu found the end zone with 1:04 remaining in the game to seal the game at 20-0 in the Crusaders favor. 
“We put up a challenge to our offensive line this past week at practice, the way they were going to go was the way we were going to go as a team. They did what they had to do,” Bound Brook head coach Dominic Longo said. 
Dual-threat junior quarterback and running back Rich Legrand ran 13 times for 24 yards as junior quarterback Spencer Spellman ran for 29 yards on nine carries for Pingry. 1 CONNECT 5 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://mycj.co/1RAgnNk TOP VIDEOS
